actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-25, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of. Waiving the requirement for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to resolutions reported on the legislatve day of March 4, 1993, providing for consideration of a bill relating to emergency unemployment compensation.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 14.
Mr. Moakley asked unanimous consent that H. Res. 111 be laid upon the table. Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

summary.text: Waives provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives that require a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to resolutions reported from such Committee on March 4, 1993, providing for consideration of a bill relating to emergency unemployment compensation.

titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.
